And that it then goes to inspector general who takes 13 months to come back with something, oh, yeah, she is ripping off the postal service. What in the world takes 13 months? What this general counsel should have done, not sent it to the I.G. Should have sent it to the local prosecutor.

utterances.speaker: DONAHOE
utterances.utterance: We have a process for that. We collect the money --

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.utterance: It doesn't matter if you collect the money. It's still a crime.

utterances.speaker: DONAHOE
utterances.utterance: I agree that it's completely unacceptable. And, again --

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.utterance: It's a crime.

utterances.speaker: DONAHOE
utterances.utterance: From the credit cards, just so you know, a person when they take that credit card, they are on the hook for the bill. We always collect it back --

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.utterance: Can you use it like an ATM card?

utterances.speaker: DONAHOE
utterances.utterance: You can use it in an ATM for a small cash advances. As a matter of fact, we've eliminated that.

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.utterance: How much? How much?

utterances.speaker: DONAHOE
utterances.utterance: You used to be able to take $500. We have eliminated that.

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.utterance: Every time you take $500 out of your ATM, that, I think, is stealing from taxpayers.

utterances.speaker: DONAHOE
utterances.utterance: No, because they have to pay it back. They have to pay it back.

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.utterance: Oh, right. You send a letter. You send a letter. After they get caught, you send a letter and say pay it back. Do you think this woman is going to pay this back without that?

utterances.speaker: DONAHOE
utterances.utterance: Absolutely. Everything gets collected.

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.utterance: Oh, man.

utterances.speaker: DONAHOE
utterances.utterance: We have ways to collect. The key thing is --

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.utterance: -- if it gets collected, why did it have to go to I.G. counsel, and why are you trying to get money from her?

utterances.speaker: DONAHOE
utterances.utterance: It's the process. It's the process.

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.utterance: Process? It's a crime.

utterances.speaker: DONAHOE
utterances.utterance: The key thing is we have a solution to our problems. Again, we have done everything we can organizationally to cut costs, grow revenue. And we need --

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.utterance: Can I -- can I get a commitment from you?

utterances.speaker: DONAHOE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.utterance: That when people steal money from the postal service, rather than go through this long process, you will call the local prosecutor and please investigate this.

utterances.speaker: DONAHOE
utterances.utterance: We go through the Department of Justice right now. We have a good --

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.utterance: Why wasn't this one done?

utterances.speaker: DONAHOE
utterances.utterance: Big difference because, if you steal from the mail, if you get into a fight with somebody, you are prosecuted and fired immediately. This is through a credit card process, that we can collect money back, so it's a little bit --

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.utterance: It is still stealing. You don't understand, just because someone pays a debt -- just because someone gets caught for stealing and says I will pay it back --

utterances.speaker: DONAHOE
utterances.utterance: We do not condone it. We do not condone it.

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.utterance: No, no. I understand that. But just because someone gets caught stealing and suddenly says I will pay it back, that doesn't mean it's not a crime.

utterances.speaker: DONAHOE
utterances.utterance: Yes. And it's not a crime -- it's a crime and we prosecute.

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.utterance: This woman didn't, but anyway.

utterances.speaker: DONAHOE
utterances.utterance: The key thing is big opportunities to do much bigger things from the postal service perspective. We need that congressional action.

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.utterance: That's a different issue. And let me just say to Congress, help this man out. Get him the legislation he needs. But the stealing thing, that's got to get an indictment, OK?

utterances.speaker: DONAHOE
utterances.utterance: I will take care of that. You have my promise.

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: DONAHOE
utterances.utterance: Have me back to talk about legislation.

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.utterance: Thank you. And, Congress, please help this man out. Anyway, Postmaster, thank you for joining us.

utterances.speaker: DONAHOE
utterances.utterance: Thank you. Thank you. Much appreciated.
